summary: The Grape Research And Protection Expansion Act (GRAPE Act), H.R. 292, amends the Federal Crop Insurance Act to support grape producers. It directs the Federal Crop Insurance Corporation to research and develop an insurance policy covering losses of table, wine, and juice grapes due to freeze events. The bill requires this new policy to be made available to farmers within 18 months of enactment. Additionally, it mandates that the Corporation report its research findings and a description of the new policy to congressional agriculture and appropriations committees within two years.
